meanings.definition: To climb up or down by gripping with the hands and legs
meanings.sent1: The cat was shinnying up the tree to chase a bird.
meanings.sent2: I saw a squirrel shinnying down the pole in the park.
meanings.sent3: The monkey was shinnying down the rope with a banana in hand.
meanings.sent4: She was shinnying up the ladder of success with determination.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter was shinnying down the building to rescue the trapped kitten.

meanings.sent1: The kids were shinnying across the playground to reach the swings first.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit was shinnying through the bushes to escape the fox.
meanings.sent3: The wind was shinnying through the leaves, making them rustle.
meanings.sent4: Time was shinnying away, urging him to finish his work.
meanings.sent5: The river was shinnying over the rocks, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: A game similar to hockey, played informally with a ball or puck
meanings.sent1: We had a great time playing shinnying in the backyard yesterday.
meanings.sent2: The neighborhood kids organized a shinnying match on the frozen pond.
meanings.sent3: The dogs joined in the shinnying game, chasing the ball around.
meanings.sent4: The sound of laughter filled the air during the shinnying match.
meanings.sent5: Shinnying is a fun way to enjoy the winter outdoors with friends.
